= Linux =

$uname -a:  Lists OS

We use the rm command to delete a directory that is not empty. The syntax is:
rm -rf dir-name
rm -rf /path/to/dir/name

$ ls -lrt /dev/sd*    lists all sd*'s
$ mount [device location] S/media
Alt + L  layout launcher for Terminator
super + r rotates windows for Terminator
shift + ctrl + direction moves windows
shift conrol z full screen terminator
Shift + ctrl + o split horizontally
shift + ctrl +  e split vertically
ctr ++ zoom in
ctr +-  zoom out
shift + ctrl + w closes terminal

alt + r resizes window

Raspberry pi debian

sudo reboot:  Reboots

sudo apt update:  Updates the package index
sudo apt upgrade: Upgrades the installed packages

sudo raspi-config: Calls the raspberry PI config

sudo shutdown
df -kh: Shows SD card
